memberdef.name: NET_DEVICE_INIT
memberdef.initializer: Z_NET_DEVICE_INIT(DT_INVALID_NODE, dev_name, drv_name, init_fn, \ pm_action_cb, data, cfg, prio, api, l2, \ l2_ctx_type, mtu)

briefdescription.para: Create a network interface and bind it to network device.

parameterdescription.para: The name this instance of the driver exposes to the system.
Address to the init function of the driver.
Pointer to PM action callback. Can be NULL if not implemented.
Pointer to the device's private data.
The address to the structure containing the configuration information for this instance of the driver.
The initialization level at which configuration occurs.
Provides an initial pointer to the API function struct used by the driver. Can be NULL.
Network L2 layer for this network interface.
Maximum transfer unit in bytes for this network interface.

memberdef.name: NET_DEVICE_DT_DEFINE
memberdef.initializer: Z_NET_DEVICE_INIT(node_id, Z_DEVICE_DT_DEV_NAME(node_id), \ DT_PROP_OR(node_id, label, ""), init_fn, \ pm_action_cb, data, cfg, prio, api, l2, \ l2_ctx_type, mtu)

briefdescription.para: Like NET_DEVICE_INIT but taking metadata from a devicetree node. Create a network interface and bind it to network device.

parameterdescription.para: Address to the init function of the driver.
Pointer to PM action callback. Can be NULL if not implemented.
Pointer to the device's private data.
The address to the structure containing the configuration information for this instance of the driver.
The initialization level at which configuration occurs.
Provides an initial pointer to the API function struct used by the driver. Can be NULL.
Network L2 layer for this network interface.
Maximum transfer unit in bytes for this network interface.

briefdescription.para: Like NET_DEVICE_DT_DEFINE for an instance of a DT_DRV_COMPAT compatible.

parameterdescription.para: instance number. This is replaced by DT_DRV_COMPAT(inst) in the call to NET_DEVICE_DT_DEFINE.
other parameters as expected by NET_DEVICE_DT_DEFINE.

memberdef.name: NET_DEVICE_INIT_INSTANCE
memberdef.initializer: Z_NET_DEVICE_INIT_INSTANCE(DT_INVALID_NODE, dev_name, drv_name, \ instance, init_fn, pm_action_cb, \ data, cfg, prio, api, l2, \ l2_ctx_type, mtu)

briefdescription.para: Create multiple network interfaces and bind them to network device. If your network device needs more than one instance of a network interface, use this macro below and provide a different instance suffix each time (0, 1, 2, ... or a, b, c ... whatever works for you)

parameterdescription.para: The name this instance of the driver exposes to the system.
Address to the init function of the driver.
Pointer to PM action callback. Can be NULL if not implemented.
Pointer to the device's private data.
The address to the structure containing the configuration information for this instance of the driver.
The initialization level at which configuration occurs.
Provides an initial pointer to the API function struct used by the driver. Can be NULL.
Network L2 layer for this network interface.
Maximum transfer unit in bytes for this network interface.

memberdef.name: NET_DEVICE_DT_DEFINE_INSTANCE
memberdef.initializer: Z_NET_DEVICE_INIT_INSTANCE(node_id, \ Z_DEVICE_DT_DEV_NAME(node_id), \ DT_LABEL(node_id), instance, \ pm_action_cb, data, cfg, prio, api, \ l2, l2_ctx_type, mtu)

briefdescription.para: Like NET_DEVICE_OFFLOAD_INIT but taking metadata from a devicetree. Create multiple network interfaces and bind them to network device. If your network device needs more than one instance of a network interface, use this macro below and provide a different instance suffix each time (0, 1, 2, ... or a, b, c ... whatever works for you)

parameterdescription.para: Address to the init function of the driver.
Pointer to PM action callback. Can be NULL if not implemented.
Pointer to the device's private data.
The address to the structure containing the configuration information for this instance of the driver.
The initialization level at which configuration occurs.
Provides an initial pointer to the API function struct used by the driver. Can be NULL.
Network L2 layer for this network interface.
Maximum transfer unit in bytes for this network interface.

briefdescription.para: Like NET_DEVICE_DT_DEFINE_INSTANCE for an instance of a DT_DRV_COMPAT compatible.

parameterdescription.para: instance number. This is replaced by DT_DRV_COMPAT(inst) in the call to NET_DEVICE_DT_DEFINE_INSTANCE.
other parameters as expected by NET_DEVICE_DT_DEFINE_INSTANCE.

memberdef.name: NET_DEVICE_OFFLOAD_INIT
memberdef.initializer: Z_NET_DEVICE_OFFLOAD_INIT(DT_INVALID_NODE, dev_name, drv_name, \ init_fn, pm_action_cb, data, cfg, prio,\ api, mtu)

briefdescription.para: Create a offloaded network interface and bind it to network device. The offloaded network interface is implemented by a device vendor HAL or similar.

parameterdescription.para: The name this instance of the driver exposes to the system.
Address to the init function of the driver.
Pointer to PM action callback. Can be NULL if not implemented.
Pointer to the device's private data.
The address to the structure containing the configuration information for this instance of the driver.
The initialization level at which configuration occurs.
Provides an initial pointer to the API function struct used by the driver. Can be NULL.
Maximum transfer unit in bytes for this network interface.

memberdef.name: NET_DEVICE_DT_OFFLOAD_DEFINE
memberdef.initializer: Z_NET_DEVICE_OFFLOAD_INIT(node_id, Z_DEVICE_DT_DEV_NAME(node_id), \ DT_PROP_OR(node_id, label, NULL), \ init_fn, pm_action_cb, data, cfg, \ prio, api, mtu)

briefdescription.para: Like NET_DEVICE_OFFLOAD_INIT but taking metadata from a devicetree node. Create a offloaded network interface and bind it to network device. The offloaded network interface is implemented by a device vendor HAL or similar.

parameterdescription.para: Address to the init function of the driver.
Pointer to PM action callback. Can be NULL if not implemented.
Pointer to the device's private data.
The address to the structure containing the configuration information for this instance of the driver.
The initialization level at which configuration occurs.
Provides an initial pointer to the API function struct used by the driver. Can be NULL.
Maximum transfer unit in bytes for this network interface.

briefdescription.para: Like NET_DEVICE_DT_OFFLOAD_DEFINE for an instance of a DT_DRV_COMPAT compatible.

parameterdescription.para: instance number. This is replaced by DT_DRV_COMPAT(inst) in the call to NET_DEVICE_DT_OFFLOAD_DEFINE.
other parameters as expected by NET_DEVICE_DT_OFFLOAD_DEFINE.

detaileddescription.para: Interface is up/ready to receive and transmit

Do not start the interface immediately after initialization. This requires that either the device driver or some other entity will need to manually take the interface up when needed. For example for Ethernet this will happen when the driver calls the net_eth_carrier_on() function.
Power management specific: interface is being suspended
Flag defines if received multicasts of other interface are forwarded on this interface. This activates multicast routing / forwarding for this interface.

memberdef.name: net_if_mcast_callback_t

briefdescription.para: Define callback that is called whenever IPv6 multicast address group is joined or left.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a struct net_if to which the multicast address is attached.
True if the address is joined, false if left.

briefdescription.para: Define callback that is called after a network packet has been sent.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a struct net_if to which the the net_pkt was sent to.
Link layer address of the destination where the network packet was sent.

briefdescription.para: Callback used while iterating over network interfaces.

parameterdescription.para: A valid pointer to user data or NULL

briefdescription.para: Set a value in network interface flags.
Test and set a value in network interface flags.

simplesect.para: true if the bit was set, false if it wasn't.

briefdescription.para: Clear a value in network interface flags.
Check if a value in network interface flags is set.

simplesect.para: True if the value is set, false otherwise

iface

pkt

return verdict about the packet

briefdescription.para: Set a network interface's link address.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a network interface structure
A pointer to a uint8_t buffer representing the address. The buffer must remain valid throughout interface lifetime.
network bearer type of this link address

simplesect.para: 0 on success

briefdescription.para: Get an network interface's MTU.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a network interface structure

simplesect.para: the MTU

briefdescription.para: Set an network interface's MTU.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a network interface structure
New MTU, note that we store only 16 bit mtu value.

briefdescription.para: Set the infinite status of the network interface address.
Get an interface according to link layer address.

simplesect.para: Network interface or NULL if not found.

briefdescription.para: Find an interface from it's related device.

simplesect.para: a valid struct net_if pointer on success, NULL otherwise

briefdescription.para: Get network interface IP config.

simplesect.para: NULL if not found or pointer to correct config settings.

briefdescription.para: Remove a router from the system.
Get the default network interface.

simplesect.para: Default interface or NULL if no interfaces are configured.

briefdescription.para: Get the first network interface according to its type.

simplesect.para: First network interface of a given type or NULL if no such interfaces was found.

briefdescription.para: Allocate network interface IPv6 config.

simplesect.para: 0 if ok, <0 if error

briefdescription.para: Release network interface IPv6 config.

simplesect.para: 0 if ok, <0 if error

briefdescription.para: Check if this IPv6 address belongs to one of the interfaces.

simplesect.para: Pointer to interface address, NULL if not found.

briefdescription.para: Check if this IPv6 address belongs to this specific interfaces.

simplesect.para: Pointer to interface address, NULL if not found.

briefdescription.para: Check if this IPv6 address belongs to one of the interface indices.

briefdescription.para: Register a multicast monitor.

parameterdescription.para: Monitor handle. This is a pointer to a monitor storage structure which should be allocated by caller, but does not need to be initialized.

briefdescription.para: Unregister a multicast monitor.

Set the prefix lifetime timer.
Unset the prefix lifetime timer.

briefdescription.para: Get the IPv6 address of the given router.

briefdescription.para: Get a network interface that should be used when sending IPv6 network data to destination.

simplesect.para: Pointer to network interface to use, NULL if no suitable interface could be found.

briefdescription.para: Get a IPv6 link local address in a given state.

parameterdescription.para: IPv6 address state (ANY, TENTATIVE, PREFERRED, DEPRECATED)

simplesect.para: Pointer to IPv6 address, NULL if not found.

briefdescription.para: Stop IPv6 Duplicate Address Detection (DAD) procedure if we find out that our IPv6 address is already in use.

parameterdescription.para: Interface where the DAD was running.

briefdescription.para: Return global IPv6 address from the first interface that has a global IPv6 address matching the given state.

parameterdescription.para: IPv6 address state (ANY, TENTATIVE, PREFERRED, DEPRECATED)
Caller can give an interface to check. If iface is set to NULL, then all the interfaces are checked. Pointer to interface where the IPv6 address is defined is returned to the caller.

simplesect.para: Pointer to IPv6 address, NULL if not found.

briefdescription.para: Get a network interface that should be used when sending IPv6 or IPv4 network data to destination.

briefdescription.para: Unregister a link callback.

briefdescription.para: Call a link callback function.

Check if received network packet checksum calculation can be avoided or not. For example many ethernet devices support network packet offloading in which case the IP stack does not need to calculate the checksum.

simplesect.para: True if checksum needs to be calculated, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Check if network packet checksum calculation can be avoided or not when sending the packet. For example many ethernet devices support network packet offloading in which case the IP stack does not need to calculate the checksum.

simplesect.para: True if checksum needs to be calculated, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get interface according to index.

simplesect.para: Pointer to interface or NULL if not found.

briefdescription.para: Get interface index according to pointer.

simplesect.para: Interface index

briefdescription.para: Go through all the network interfaces and call callback for each interface.
Bring interface up.

simplesect.para: 0 on success

briefdescription.para: Check if interface is up.

simplesect.para: True if interface is up, False if it is down.

briefdescription.para: Bring interface down.

simplesect.para: 0 on success

briefdescription.para: Set network interface into promiscuous mode.

detaileddescription.para: Note that not all network technologies will support this.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, <0 if error

briefdescription.para: Set network interface into normal mode.
Check if promiscuous mode is set or not.

simplesect.para: True if interface is in promisc mode, False if interface is not in in promiscuous mode.

briefdescription.para: Check if there are any pending TX network data for a given network interface.

simplesect.para: True if there are pending TX network packets for this network interface, False otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Public API for network interface.
